author: AAP
description: A “bomb cyclone” is set to dump more than 100mm of rain in the space of hours on Australia’s east coast, along with damaging winds of up to 110 kilometres per hour. Millions of residents from Coffs Harbour south to Bega are in the path of a fast-moving, severe low pressure system intensifying off the […]
title: Millions in the Path of a ‘Bomb Cyclone’ as Rain Hits

author: Savannah Hulsey Pointer
description: Lead singer Bob Vylan led attendees at Glastonbury festival in chants of 'death, death to the IDF,' referring to the Israel Defense Forces.
title: US Revokes Visas for British Punk-Rap Duo Over Anti-Israel Chant

author: Terri Wu
description: Beijing has to revisit its strategies and reconsider its approach to the Trump administration, experts say.
title: How Iran War Exposed Limits of Chinese Influence in Region

author: Epoch Times Staff
description: A glimpse into the world through the lens of photography.
title: Day in Photos: Migrants Crossing English Channel, Forest Fires in Turkey, and Largest Flower Bloomed

author: Noé Chartier
description: Prime Minister Mark Carney said progress is being made in trying to reach a trade deal with the United States, hours after his government said it will abandon its Digital Services Tax following U.S. President Donald Trump’s declaration that talks would end over the tax. Carney briefly spoke to reporters on June 30 as he […]
title: Carney Says Progress Made on US Deal as White House Says Canada ‘Caved’ on Digital Services Tax

author: The Canadian Press
description: British Columbia’s attorney general says the government has received a report from a retired judge on ways to improve safety and security at events after 11 people were killed and many more injured at a Vancouver festival. Premier David Eby commissioned the inquiry into safety at community events shortly after a vehicle tore through a […]
title: BC Government Gets Report Looking Into Safety at Events After Lapu Lapu Attack

author: Noé Chartier
description: The City of Ottawa has fired one of its lawyers who stands accused of spreading red paint on the National Holocaust Monument in Ottawa. A 46-year-old Ottawa man has been charged in connection with the incident, the Ottawa Police Service (OPS) said in a June 27 press release. The man has been charged with mischief […]
title: Lawyer Accused in Holocaust Memorial Vandalism Fired by City of Ottawa

author: Matthew Horwood
description: Ottawa has announced new steel quotas to bolster the industry in response to U.S. tariffs, imposing a 50 percent surtax on steel imports exceeding 2024 levels from countries with which Canada does not have a free trade agreement. “Our government has a mandate to build one Canadian economy—the strongest in the G7. That means standing […]
title: Ottawa Announces 50 Percent Surcharge on Some Steel Imports to Support Industry

author: Jack Phillips
description: The variant is different from one that is currently dominant in the United States and it drove infections in China this year.
title: WHO Announces COVID XFG Is a ‘Variant Under Monitoring’

author: Crystal-Rose Jones
description: More than 900 people in a coastal town of less than 6,000 have written to the local council objecting to the planned project.
title: Hundreds Push Back Against Aboriginal-Only Group Home in Quiet Suburb

author: Conrad Black
description: Commentary Upon the approach of July 1, it is always a temptation to collapse into maudlin platitudes and wave the maple leaf flag around somewhat thoughtlessly. Regular readers will be aware of my frequent remonstrations about the failure of most Canadians to develop much awareness of our history. This is an abundant country with a […]
title: Conrad Black: Canada Has Much to Be Proud Of

description: The White House said it was a way to support the country's path to stability.

description: The Digital Services Act and the Digital Markets Act have both been heavily criticized by the Trump administration.

description: Ottawa rescinded the tax on June 29, after US President Donald Trump terminated trade talks in objection to the tax on June 27.
title: Canada-US Trade Talks Resuming Immediately After Vow to Axe Digital Services Tax: White House

author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: At the state level, what it means to be Canadian and pride in the True North has undergone dramatic changes in recent years. Freshly in office in 2015, former Prime minister Justin Trudeau famously said the country is a “postnational state” with “no core identity.” Allegations in 2021 from indigenous bands saying radar scans found […]
title: What Does Canada Day Mean to You This Year? Canadians Speak Out

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: A recall has been issued for Peeters Mushroom Farm sliced mushrooms distributed in Ontario and Quebec due to potential Listeria monocytogenes contamination. The weekend advisory was triggered by test results from the Canadian Food Inspection Agency, which has also launched a safety investigation that could result in the recall of additional products. The four different […]
title: Mushrooms Pulled from Shelves in Ontario, Quebec Due to Listeria Risk

author: Audrey Enjoli
description: Cecil the lion was 13 when he was hunted and killed on the outskirts of Zimbabwe’s Hwange National Park on July 1, 2015.
title: Eduardo Gonçalves Debuts Anti-Trophy Hunting Book Trilogy on 10th Anniversary of Cecil the Lion’s Death

author: The Canadian Press
description: A new report by the Canadian Federation of Independent Business says progress has been made on removing trade barriers within Canada, but it adds that the patchwork of approaches could create new issues. The organization’s latest “internal trade report card” grades the federal and provincial governments based on factors related to interprovincial and territorial co-operation. […]
title: CFIB Says Internal Trade Barriers Coming Down, but Patchwork Could Create Challenges

author: Jack Phillips
description: It comes after Trump asserted that the United States 'obliterated their nuclear facilities' and added that he isn't offering Iran any deal.
title: Iranian UN Official Says Country’s Nuclear Enrichment Will ‘Never Stop’

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: National pride is on the upswing in Canada since last year, yet fewer than half of the country’s citizens report feeling “very proud” to be Canadian, a new survey suggests. Forty-three percent of those polled by Angus Reid this month say they are “very proud” to be Canadian, up from the 34 percent who expressed […]
title: Canadian Pride and Optimism on the Rise, but Still Well Below 1980s Levels

author: Adam Morrow
description: A Ukrainian F-16 pilot was killed during a wide-ranging Russian attack involving hundreds of missiles and drones, officials in Kyiv said on June 29. The attack damaged homes and infrastructure in several parts of the country—including the capital, Kyiv—and left 12 people injured, local authorities said. While the attack was underway, explosions were heard across […]
title: Ukrainian F-16 Pilot Killed While Repelling Russian Aerial Attack

description: The Israel Defense Forces warned that it will operate with ‘extreme force’ in several neighborhoods in Gaza City and Jabalia.

description: Trump has a plan for trade partners that cannot meet the due date.

description: U.S. Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick thanked Canada for rescinding its digital services tax in a move to resume trade negotiations with the United States. In a post on social media, Lutnick says the tax would have been “a deal breaker” for any trade deal with the U.S. The Canadian government announced late Sunday that it […]
title: Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick Thanks Canada for Dropping Digital Services Tax

description: 'For your safety, evacuate immediately to the south, to the Al-Mawasi area,' the IDF said.

description: U.S. authorities could be looking into canceling the visa of the band Bob Vylan ahead of their nationwide tour.

description: Prime Minister Mark Carney has called a byelection in the Alberta riding of Battle River-Crowfoot, which Tory Leader Pierre Poilievre is expected to run in. Carney’s office, in a statement issued on June 30, said the byelection will take place on Monday, August 18. According to electoral law, an election campaign must be at least […]
title: Poilievre’s Chance at House Return Will Come August 18 as Carney Calls Byelection

author: Chris Summers
description: The president said in a social media post that he is not talking to Iran after B-2 bombers 'totally obliterated their nuclear facilities.'

author: Marco Navarro-Génie
description: Commentary Confederation was largely a defensive act prompted by fear of the United States. The architects recognized that a fragmented British North America risked being overtaken or becoming a battleground. With the end of the American Civil War, diminishing British interest, and tensions heightened by Fenian attacks, Confederation aimed to protect British institutions north of […]
title: Fulfilling Canada’s Promise

description: The project is one of a number of Australian green hydrogen projects which has fallen over before completion.

author: The Canadian Press
description: Lululemon Athletica Canada Inc. is accusing Costco Wholesale Corp. of infringing on its intellectual property by selling knockoffs of some of its most popular products. A lawsuit filed in a California court recently alleges Costco sells dupes of Lululemon’s Scuba hoodies and sweatshirts, Define jackets and ABC pants. Some of the alleged fakes Vancouver-based Lululemon […]
title: Lululemon Sues Costco for Selling Alleged Dupes of Its Products

author: Rex Widerstrom
description: Restructuring is a type of external administration companies undergo when insolvent, with the alternative being liquidation.
title: Small Business Restructurings up 300 Percent in a Year, Set to Soar Further

author: The Associated Press
description: ROME—Major heat waves across Southern Europe have pushed temperatures above 104 F in countries including Italy, Spain, and Greece, as local authorities issued fresh warnings against the risk of wildfires. Severe heat waves were recorded in Italy, Greece, Spain, and Portugal before the weekend, with locals and tourists alike taking shelter from the sweltering conditions. […]
title: Severe Heat Waves Hit Southern Europe

author: The Associated Press
description: MIAMI—Tropical Storm Barry formed Sunday near Mexico’s southeast coast and is expected to drench the region for several days. The storm’s center was located about 35 miles east-northeast of Tuxpan, Mexico, according to the U.S. National Hurricane Center in Miami. It had maximum sustained winds of 45 mph and was moving northwest at 9 mph. […]
title: Tropical Storms Barry and Flossie Form Off Mexico’s Southeast and Southwest Coasts
